meanings.definition: Continuing or recurring throughout the year
meanings.sent1: The perennially blooming flowers added color to the garden all year.
meanings.sent2: The perennially green trees provided shade in every season.
meanings.sent3: The perennially sunny weather made the residents forget about winter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a perennially bright light in the darkness of his life.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waterfall was perennially soothing to her ears.

meanings.definition: Enduring or existing for a long time
meanings.sent1: The perennially strong oak tree stood tall for decades.
meanings.sent2: Their friendship was perennially strong, lasting through thick and thin.
meanings.sent3: The perennially late bus driver always managed to arrive just in time.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like a perennially burning flame that never faded.
meanings.sent5: The old clock in the hallway was perennially ticking, a constant reminder of time passing.

meanings.definition: Lasting or remaining active or popular indefinitely
meanings.sent1: The perennially popular ice cream shop always had a long line.
meanings.sent2: Her talent for singing was perennially recognized by the audience.
meanings.sent3: The perennially full mailbox made him feel like a celebrity.
meanings.sent4: The idea of kindness is perennially relevant in a world full of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The story of the hero's journey is perennially captivating to readers of all ages.
